definition: to be in flood/to overflow (the banks)/to inundate/to spread unchecked
lit. to flood (idiom)/fig. rampant/in plague proportions

sentences.english: Standardization of information definition can check availably non-criterion definition to deluge.
sentences.chinese: 信息定義的標準化可以有效抑止不規範定義的泛濫。

sentences.english: He calls the proliferation of master's degrees evidence of “credentialing gone amok.
sentences.chinese: 他稱碩士學位的泛濫跡象是“文憑獲得走向狂亂。”

sentences.english: Therefore this psychology preceded the inundation of Caudillo politics after independence.
sentences.chinese: 在獨立後，這一心態助長了考迪羅主義的泛濫。

sentences.english: Therefore this psychology preceded the inundation of Caudillo politics after …
sentences.chinese: 在獨立後，這一心態助長了考迪羅主義的泛濫。

sentences.english: But heavy fishing for tuna and other predatory fish is allowing the squid to flourish.
sentences.chinese: 過度捕撈金槍魚和其它的食內魚類造成了烏賊的泛濫。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
